5592.verse-arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ هَلْ أَتَىٰ عَلَى الْإِنسَانِ حِينٌ مِّنَ الدَّهْرِ لَمْ يَكُن شَيْئًا مَّذْكُورًا
5592.verse-english: Has there [not] come upon man a period of time when he was not a thing [even] mentioned?

clauses-arabic.clause: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ هَلْ أَتَىٰ عَلَى الْإِنسَانِ حِينٌ مِّنَ الدَّهْرِ لَمْ يَكُن شَيْئًا مَّذْكُورًا

clauses-english.clause: Has there [not] come upon man a period of time when he was not a thing [even] mentioned?

5593.verse-arabic: إِنَّا خَلَقْنَا الْإِنسَانَ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ أَمْشَاجٍ نَّبْتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلْنَاهُ سَمِيعًا بَصِيرًا
5593.verse-english: Indeed, We created man from a sperm-drop mixture that We may try him; and We made him hearing and seeing.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
We created man from a sperm-
drop mixture that We may try him;
and We made him hearing and seeing.

5594.verse-arabic: إِنَّا هَدَيْنَاهُ السَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرًا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا
5594.verse-english: Indeed, We guided him to the way, be he grateful or be he ungrateful.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
We guided him to the way,
be he grateful or be he ungrateful.

5595.verse-arabic: إِنَّا أَعْتَدْنَا لِلْكَافِرِينَ سَلَاسِلَ وَأَغْلَالًا وَسَعِيرًا
5595.verse-english: Indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains and shackles and a blaze.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
We have prepared for the disbelievers chains and shackles and a blaze.

5596.verse-arabic: إِنَّ الْأَبْرَارَ يَشْرَبُونَ مِن كَأْسٍ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا
5596.verse-english: Indeed, the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of Kafur,

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of Kafur,

5597.verse-arabic: عَيْنًا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ اللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفْجِيرًا
5597.verse-english: A spring of which the [righteous] servants of Allah will drink; they will make it gush forth in force [and abundance].

clauses-english.clause: A spring of which the [righteous] servants of God will drink;
they will make it gush forth in force [and abundance].

5598.verse-arabic: يُوفُونَ بِالنَّذْرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوْمًا كَانَ شَرُّهُ مُسْتَطِيرًا
5598.verse-english: They [are those who] fulfill [their] vows and fear a Day whose evil will be widespread.

clauses-arabic.clause: يُوفُونَ بِالنَّذْرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوْمًا كَانَ شَرُّهُ مُسْتَطِيرًا

clauses-english.clause: They [are those who] fulfill [their] vows and fear a Day whose evil will be widespread.

5599.verse-arabic: وَيُطْعِمُونَ الطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِ مِسْكِينًا وَيَتِيمًا وَأَسِيرًا
5599.verse-english: And they give food in spite of love for it to the needy, the orphan, and the captive,

clauses-english.clause: And they give food in spite of love for it to the needy,
the orphan,
and the captive,

5600.verse-arabic: إِنَّمَا نُطْعِمُكُمْ لِوَجْهِ اللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنكُمْ جَزَاءً وَلَا شُكُورًا
5600.verse-english: [Saying], "We feed you only for the countenance of Allah. We wish not from you reward or gratitude.

clauses-english.clause: [Saying],
"We feed you only for the countenance of God.
We wish not from you reward or gratitude.

5601.verse-arabic: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا يَوْمًا عَبُوسًا قَمْطَرِيرًا
5601.verse-english: Indeed, We fear from our Lord a Day austere and distressful."

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
We fear from our Lord a Day austere and distressful.

5602.verse-arabic: فَوَقَاهُمُ اللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمِ وَلَقَّاهُمْ نَضْرَةً وَسُرُورًا
5602.verse-english: So Allah will protect them from the evil of that Day and give them radiance and happiness

clauses-arabic.clause: فَوَقَاهُمُ اللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمِ وَلَقَّاهُمْ نَضْرَةً وَسُرُورًا

clauses-english.clause: So God will protect them from the evil of that Day and give them radiance and happiness

5603.verse-english: And will reward them for what they patiently endured [with] a garden [in Paradise] and silk [garments].

clauses-english.clause: And will reward them for what they patiently endured [with] a garden [in Paradise] and silk [garments].

5604.verse-arabic: مُّتَّكِئِينَ فِيهَا عَلَى الْأَرَائِكِ ۖ لَا يَرَوْنَ فِيهَا شَمْسًا وَلَا زَمْهَرِيرًا
5604.verse-english: [They will be] reclining therein on adorned couches. They will not see therein any [burning] sun or [freezing] cold.

clauses-english.clause: [They will be] reclining therein on adorned couches.
They will not see therein any [burning] sun or [freezing] cold.

5605.verse-arabic: وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيْهِمْ ظِلَالُهَا وَذُلِّلَتْ قُطُوفُهَا تَذْلِيلًا
5605.verse-english: And near above them are its shades, and its [fruit] to be picked will be lowered in compliance.

clauses-english.clause: And near above them are its shades,
and its [fruit] to be picked will be lowered in compliance.

5606.verse-arabic: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيْهِم بِآنِيَةٍ مِّن فِضَّةٍ وَأَكْوَابٍ كَانَتْ قَوَارِيرَا
5606.verse-english: And there will be circulated among them vessels of silver and cups having been [created] clear [as glass],

clauses-arabic.clause: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيْهِم بِآنِيَةٍ مِّن فِضَّةٍ وَأَكْوَابٍ كَانَتْ قَوَارِيرَا

clauses-english.clause: And there will be circulated among them vessels of silver and cups having been [created] clear [as glass],

5607.verse-english: Clear glasses [made] from silver of which they have determined the measure.

clauses-english.clause: Clear glasses [made] from silver of which they have determined the measure.

5608.verse-arabic: وَيُسْقَوْنَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنجَبِيلًا
5608.verse-english: And they will be given to drink a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of ginger

clauses-arabic.clause: وَيُسْقَوْنَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنجَبِيلًا

clauses-english.clause: And they will be given to drink a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of ginger

5609.verse-english: [From] a fountain within Paradise named Salsabeel.

clauses-english.clause: [From] a fountain within Paradise named Salsabeel.

5610.verse-arabic: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ وِلْدَانٌ مُّخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيْتَهُمْ حَسِبْتَهُمْ لُؤْلُؤًا مَّنثُورًا
5610.verse-english: There will circulate among them young boys made eternal. When you see them, you would think them [as beautiful as] scattered pearls.

clauses-english.clause: There will circulate among them young boys made eternal.
When you see them,
you would think them [as beautiful as] scattered pearls.

5611.verse-arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَيْتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيْتَ نَعِيمًا وَمُلْكًا كَبِيرًا
5611.verse-english: And when you look there [in Paradise], you will see pleasure and great dominion.

clauses-english.clause: And when you look there [in Paradise],
you will see pleasure and great dominion.

5612.verse-arabic: عَالِيَهُمْ ثِيَابُ سُندُسٍ خُضْرٌ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٌ ۖ وَحُلُّوا أَسَاوِرَ مِن فِضَّةٍ وَسَقَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ شَرَابًا طَهُورًا
5612.verse-english: Upon the inhabitants will be green garments of fine silk and brocade. And they will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a purifying drink.

clauses-english.clause: Upon the inhabitants will be green garments of fine silk and brocade.
And they will be adorned with bracelets of silver,
and their Lord will give them a purifying drink.

5613.verse-arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمْ جَزَاءً وَكَانَ سَعْيُكُم مَّشْكُورًا
5613.verse-english: [And it will be said], "Indeed, this is for you a reward, and your effort has been appreciated."

clauses-english.clause: [And it will be said],
"Indeed,
this is for you a reward,
and your effort has been appreciated.

5614.verse-arabic: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكَ الْقُرْآنَ تَنزِيلًا
5614.verse-english: Indeed, it is We who have sent down to you, [O Muhammad], the Qur'an progressively.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
it is We who have sent down to you,
[O Muhammad],
the Qur'an progressively.

5615.verse-arabic: فَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعْ مِنْهُمْ آثِمًا أَوْ كَفُورًا
5615.verse-english: So be patient for the decision of your Lord and do not obey from among them a sinner or ungrateful [disbeliever].

clauses-arabic.clause: فَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعْ مِنْهُمْ آثِمًا أَوْ كَفُورًا

clauses-english.clause: So be patient for the decision of your Lord and do not obey from among them a sinner or ungrateful [disbeliever].

5616.verse-english: And mention the name of your Lord [in prayer] morning and evening

clauses-english.clause: And mention the name of your Lord [in prayer] morning and evening

5617.verse-arabic: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَاسْجُدْ لَهُ وَسَبِّحْهُ لَيْلًا طَوِيلًا
5617.verse-english: And during the night prostrate to Him and exalt Him a long [part of the] night.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَاسْجُدْ لَهُ وَسَبِّحْهُ لَيْلًا طَوِيلًا

clauses-english.clause: And during the night prostrate to Him and exalt Him a long [part of the] night.

5618.verse-arabic: إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ يُحِبُّونَ الْعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَاءَهُمْ يَوْمًا ثَقِيلًا
5618.verse-english: Indeed, these [disbelievers] love the immediate and leave behind them a grave Day.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
these [disbelievers] love the immediate and leave behind them a grave Day.

5619.verse-arabic: نَّحْنُ خَلَقْنَاهُمْ وَشَدَدْنَا أَسْرَهُمْ ۖ وَإِذَا شِئْنَا بَدَّلْنَا أَمْثَالَهُمْ تَبْدِيلًا
5619.verse-english: We have created them and strengthened their forms, and when We will, We can change their likenesses with [complete] alteration.

clauses-english.clause: We have created them and strengthened their forms,
and when We will,
We can change their likenesses with [complete] alteration.

5620.verse-arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِ تَذْكِرَةٌ ۖ فَمَن شَاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبِيلًا
5620.verse-english: Indeed, this is a reminder, so he who wills may take to his Lord a way.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
this is a reminder,
so he who wills may take to his Lord a way.

5621.verse-arabic: وَمَا تَشَاءُونَ إِلَّا أَن يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًا
5621.verse-english: And you do not will except that Allah wills. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.

clauses-english.clause: And you do not will except that God wills.
Indeed,
God is ever Knowing and Wise.

5622.verse-arabic: يُدْخِلُ مَن يَشَاءُ فِي رَحْمَتِهِ ۚ وَالظَّالِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
5622.verse-english: He admits whom He wills into His mercy; but the wrongdoers - He has prepared for them a painful punishment.

clauses-english.clause: He admits whom He wills into His mercy;
but the wrongdoers -
He has prepared for them a painful punishment.
